ArticleTitle.sentence: Coactivation by OCA-B: definition of critical regions and synergism with general cofactors.

event.clue: Coactivation by OCA-B: definition of critical regions and synergism with general cofactors.
Coactivation by OCA-B: definition of critical regions and synergism with general cofactors.

AbstractText.sentence: Molecular dissection of the B-cell-specific transcription coactivator OCA-B has revealed distinct regions important, respectively, for recruitment to immunoglobulin promoters through interaction with octamer-bound Oct-1 and for subsequent coactivator function.

event.clue: Molecular dissection of the B-cell-specific transcription coactivator OCA-B has revealed distinct regions important, respectively, for recruitment to immunoglobulin promoters through interaction with octamer-bound Oct-1 and for subsequent coactivator function.

AbstractText.sentence: Further analysis of general coactivator requirements showed that selective removal of PC4 from the essential USA fraction severely impairs Oct-1 and OCA-B function in a cell-free system reconstituted with partially purified factors.

event.clue: Further analysis of general coactivator requirements showed that selective removal of PC4 from the essential USA fraction severely impairs Oct-1 and OCA-B function in a cell-free system reconstituted with partially purified factors.

AbstractText.sentence: Full activity can be restored by the combined action of recombinant PC4 and the PC4-depleted USA fraction, thus suggesting a joint requirement for PC4 and another, USA-derived component(s) for optimal function of Oct-1/OCA-B in the reconstituted system.

AbstractText.sentence: Indeed, USA-derived PC2 was found to act synergistically with PC4 in reproducing the function of intact USA in the assay system.

event.clue: Indeed, USA-derived PC2 was found to act synergistically with PC4 in reproducing the function of intact USA in the assay system.

AbstractText.sentence: Consistent with the requirement for PC4 in the reconstituted system, OCA-B was found to interact directly with PC4.

event.clue: Consistent with the requirement for PC4 in the reconstituted system, OCA-B was found to interact directly with PC4.
Consistent with the requirement for PC4 in the reconstituted system, OCA-B was found to interact directly with PC4.

AbstractText.sentence: Surprisingly, however, removal of PC4 from the unfractionated nuclear extract has no detrimental effect on OCA-B/Oct-1-dependent transcription.

event.clue: Surprisingly, however, removal of PC4 from the unfractionated nuclear extract has no detrimental effect on OCA-B/Oct-1-dependent transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: These results lead to a general model for the synergistic function of activation domains in Oct-1 and OCA-B (mediated by the combined action of the multiple USA components) and, further, suggest a functional redundancy in general coactivators.

event.clue: These results lead to a general model for the synergistic function of activation domains in Oct-1 and OCA-B (mediated by the combined action of the multiple USA components) and, further, suggest a functional redundancy in general coactivators.
